017package org.apache.commons.chain.web;
018
019import java.io.IOException;
020
021import javax.servlet.ServletConfig;
022import javax.servlet.ServletContext;
023import javax.servlet.ServletException;
024import javax.servlet.http.HttpServlet;
025import javax.servlet.http.HttpServletRequest;
026import javax.servlet.http.HttpServletResponse;
027
028import org.apache.commons.chain.Catalog;
029import org.apache.commons.chain.CatalogFactory;
030import org.apache.commons.chain.config.ConfigParser;
031import org.apache.commons.chain.impl.CatalogBase;
032import org.apache.commons.digester.RuleSet;
033import org.apache.commons.logging.Log;
034import org.apache.commons.logging.LogFactory;
035
036/**
037 * {@code Servlet} that automatically scans chain configuration files
038 * in the current web application at startup time, and exposes the result in a
039 * {@link Catalog} under a specified servlet context attribute. The following
040 * <em>servlet</em> init parameters are utilized:
041 * <ul>
042 * <li><strong>org.apache.commons.chain.CONFIG_CLASS_RESOURCE</strong> -
043 *     comma-delimited list of chain configuration resources to be loaded
044 *     via {@code ClassLoader.getResource()} calls. If not specified,
045 *     no class loader resources will be loaded.</li>
046 * <li><strong>org.apache.commons.chain.CONFIG_WEB_RESOURCE</strong> -
047 *     comma-delimited list of chain configuration webapp resources
048 *     to be loaded. If not specified, no web application resources
049 *     will be loaded.</li>
050 * <li><strong>org.apache.commons.chain.CONFIG_ATTR</strong> -
051 *     Name of the servlet context attribute under which the
052 *     resulting {@link Catalog} will be created or updated.
053 *     If not specified, it is expected that parsed resources will
054 *     contain {@code &lt;catalog&gt;} elements (which will
055 *     cause registration of the created {@link Catalog}s into
056 *     the {@link CatalogFactory} for this application, and no
057 *     servet context attribute will be created.
058 *     <strong>NOTE</strong> - This parameter is deprecated.</li>
059 * <li><strong>org.apache.commons.chain.RULE_SET</strong> -
060 *     Fully qualified class name of a Digester {@code RuleSet}
061 *     implementation to use for parsing configuration resources (this
062 *     class must have a public zero-args constructor). If not defined,
063 *     the standard {@code RuleSet} implementation will be used.</li>
064 * </ul>
065 *
066 * <p>When a web application that has configured this servlet is
067 * started, it will acquire the {@link Catalog} under the specified servlet
068 * context attribute key, creating a new one if there is none already there.
069 * This {@link Catalog} will then be populated by scanning configuration
070 * resources from the following sources (loaded in this order):</p>
071 * <ul>
072 * <li>Resources loaded from specified resource paths from the
073 *     webapp's class loader (via {@code ClassLoader.getResource()}).</li>
074 * <li>Resources loaded from specified resource paths in the web application
075 *     archive (via {@code ServetContext.getResource()}).</li>
076 * </ul>
077 *
078 * <p>If no attribute key is specified, on the other hand, parsed configuration
079 * resources are expected to contain {@code &lt;catalog&gt;} elements,
080 * and the catalogs will be registered with the {@link CatalogFactory}
081 * for this web application.</p>
082 *
083 * <p>This class runs on Servlet 2.2 or later. If you are running on a
084 * Servlet 2.3 or later system, you should also consider using
085 * {@link ChainListener} to initialize your {@link Catalog}. Note that
086 * {@link ChainListener} uses parameters of the same names, but they are
087 * <em>context</em> init parameters instead of <em>servlet</em> init
088 * parameters. Because of this, you can use both facilities in the
089 * same application, if desired.</p>
090 *
091 * @author Matthew J. Sgarlata
092 * @author Craig R. McClanahan
093 * @author Ted Husted
094 */
095public class ChainServlet extends HttpServlet {
096    private static final long serialVersionUID = -6545081938506661333L;
097
098    // ------------------------------------------------------ Manifest Constants
099
100    /**
101     * The name of the context init parameter containing the name of the
102     * servlet context attribute under which our resulting {@link Catalog}
103     * will be stored.
104     */
105    public static final String CONFIG_ATTR =
106        "org.apache.commons.chain.CONFIG_ATTR";
107
108    /**
109     * The name of the context init parameter containing a comma-delimited
110     * list of class loader resources to be scanned.
111     */
112    public static final String CONFIG_CLASS_RESOURCE =
113        "org.apache.commons.chain.CONFIG_CLASS_RESOURCE";
114
115    /**
116     * The name of the context init parameter containing a comma-delimited
117     * list of web application resources to be scanned.
118     */
119    public static final String CONFIG_WEB_RESOURCE =
120        "org.apache.commons.chain.CONFIG_WEB_RESOURCE";
121
122    /**
123     * The name of the context init parameter containing the fully
124     * qualified class name of the {@code RuleSet} implementation
125     * for configuring our {@link ConfigParser}.
126     */
127    public static final String RULE_SET =
128        "org.apache.commons.chain.RULE_SET";
129
130    // --------------------------------------------------------- Servlet Methods
131
132    /**
133     * Clean up after ourselves as this application shuts down.
134     */
135    @Override
136    public void destroy() {
137        ServletConfig config = getServletConfig();
138        ServletContext context = getServletContext();
139        String attr = config.getInitParameter(CONFIG_ATTR);
140        if (attr != null) {
141            context.removeAttribute(attr);
142        }
143        CatalogFactory.clear();
144    }
145
146    /**
147     * Create (if necessary) and configure a {@link Catalog} from the
148     * servlet init parameters that have been specified.
149     *
150     * @throws ServletException if the servlet could not be initialized
151     */
152    @Override
153    @SuppressWarnings("deprecation")
154    public void init() throws ServletException {
155        Log log = LogFactory.getLog(ChainServlet.class);
156        ServletConfig config = getServletConfig();
157        ServletContext context = getServletContext();
158        if (log.isInfoEnabled()) {
159            log.info("Initializing chain servlet '"
160                     + config.getServletName() + "'");
161        }
162
163        // Retrieve servlet init parameters that we need
164        String attr = config.getInitParameter(CONFIG_ATTR);
165        String classResources =
166            context.getInitParameter(CONFIG_CLASS_RESOURCE);
167        String ruleSet = context.getInitParameter(RULE_SET);
168        String webResources = context.getInitParameter(CONFIG_WEB_RESOURCE);
169
170        // Retrieve or create the Catalog instance we may be updating
171        Catalog<?> catalog = null;
172        if (attr != null) {
173            catalog = (Catalog<?>) context.getAttribute(attr);
174            if (catalog == null) {
175                catalog = new CatalogBase<>();
176            }
177        }
178
179        // Construct the configuration resource parser we will use
180        ConfigParser parser = new ConfigParser();
181        if (ruleSet != null) {
182            try {
183                ClassLoader loader =
184                    Thread.currentThread().getContextClassLoader();
185                if (loader == null) {
186                    loader = this.getClass().getClassLoader();
187                }
188                Class<? extends RuleSet> clazz = loader
189                        .loadClass(ruleSet)
190                        .asSubclass(RuleSet.class);
191                parser.setRuleSet(clazz.getDeclaredConstructor().newInstance());
192            } catch (Exception e) {
193                throw new ServletException("Exception initalizing RuleSet '"
194                                           + ruleSet + "' instance", e);
195            }
196        }
197
198        // Parse the resources specified in our init parameters (if any)
199        if (attr == null) {
200            ChainResources.parseClassResources(classResources, parser);
201            ChainResources.parseWebResources(context, webResources, parser);
202        } else {
203            ChainResources.parseClassResources(catalog, classResources, parser);
204            ChainResources.parseWebResources(catalog, context, webResources, parser);
205        }
206
207        // Expose the completed catalog (if requested)
208        if (attr != null) {
209            context.setAttribute(attr, catalog);
210        }
211    }
212
213    /**
214     * Does nothing; this servlet's only purpose is to initialize a Chain
215     * and store it in the servlet context.
216     *
217     * @param request the request issued by the client
218     * @param response the response to be returned to the cliengt
219     *
220     * @throws ServletException this exception is never thrown
221     * @throws IOException this exception is never thrown
222     */
223    @Override
224    public void service(HttpServletRequest request,
225                        HttpServletResponse response)
226        throws ServletException, IOException {
227
228          // do nothing
229    }
230}
